intro: Lepicaune prunellifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed prunellifolium, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded locations. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
